Field Detail

fileData

private FileData fileData
The FileData instance that contains all information about the file to upload.

fileUploadThread

private FileUploadThread fileUploadThread
Instance of the fileUploadThread. This allow this class to send feedback to the thread.

See Also:
FileUploadThread.nbBytesUploaded(long)

inputStream

private java.io.InputStream inputStream
inputStream contains the stream that read from the file to upload. This may be a transformed version of the file (for instance, a compressed one).

See Also:
FileData.getInputStream()

uploadRemainingLength

private long uploadRemainingLength
The number of bytes to upload, for this file (without the head and tail defined for the HTTP multipart body).

uploadPolicy

private UploadPolicy uploadPolicy
The current UploadPolicy

Method Detail

getFileHeader

java.lang.String getFileHeader(int fileIndex,
                               java.lang.String boundary,
                               int chunkPart)
                         throws JUploadException
Returns the header for this file, within the http multipart body.

Parameters:
fileIndex - Index of the file in the array that contains all files to upload.
boundary - The boundary that separate files in the http multipart post body.
chunkPart - The numero of the current chunk (from 1 to n)
Returns:
The header for this file.
Throws:
JUploadException

getRemainingLength

long getRemainingLength()
Get the number of files that are still to upload. It is initialized at the creation of the file, by a call to the FileData.getUploadLength().
Note: When the upload for this file is finish and you want to send it again (for instance the upload failed, and you want to do a retry), you should not reuse this instance, but, instead, create a new UploadFileData instance.

Returns:
Number of bytes still to upload.
See Also:
getInputStream()

uploadFile

void uploadFile(java.io.OutputStream outputStream,
                long nbBytesToWrite)
          throws JUploadException
This methods upload write the file data to upload (see FileData.getInputStream() to the given outputStream (the output toward the HTTP server).

Parameters:
outputStream - The stream on which the file is to be written.
Throws:
JUploadException - Any troubles that could occurs during upload.

afterUpload

public void afterUpload()
This method closes the inputstream, and remove the file from the filepanel. Then it calls FileData.afterUpload().

Specified by:
afterUpload in interface FileData
See Also:
FileData.afterUpload()

beforeUpload

public void beforeUpload()
                  throws JUploadException
Description copied from interface: FileData
Prepare the fileData to upload. For instance, picture data can be resized before upload (see PictureFileData. This method is called before the upload of this file.

beforeUpload in interface FileData

getInputStream

public java.io.InputStream getInputStream()
                                   throws JUploadException
Description copied from interface: FileData
This function create an input stream for this file. The FileUploadThreadV3 class can then read bytes from it, to transfert them to the webserver. The caller is responsible for closing this input stream.

Specified by:
getInputStream in interface FileData
Returns:
An inputStream
Throws:
JUploadException
See Also:
FileData.getInputStream()

getUploadLength

public long getUploadLength()
                     throws JUploadException
Description copied from interface: FileData
Get size of upload, which may be different from th actual file length.

Specified by:
getUploadLength in interface FileData
Returns:
The length of upload. In this class, this is the size of the file, as it isn't transformed for upload. This size may change if encoding is necessary (needs a new FileData class), or if picture is to be resized or rotated.
Throws:
JUploadException
See Also:
FileData.getUploadLength()
